intro: Adenia ecirrosa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved adenia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Randiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are berries that turn red when mature, attracting various bird species. Adenia ecirrosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and thickets.
